00001 #########################################################################
00002 #
00003 #  Implements the Complex class
00004 #
00005 package Parser::Complex;
00006 use strict; no strict "refs";
00007 our @ISA = qw(Parser::Item);
00008 
00009 $Parser::class->{Complex} = 'Parser::Complex';
00010 
00011 sub new {
00012   my $self = shift; my $class = ref($self) || $self;
00013   my $equation = shift; my $context = $equation->{context};
00014   my $num; my ($value,$ref) = @_;
00015   $value = [$value,0] unless ref($value) eq 'ARRAY';
00016   $value->[1] = 0 unless defined($value->[1]);
00017   $equation->Error("Complex Numbers must have real and complex parts",$ref)
00018     if (scalar(@{$value}) != 2);
00019   $num = bless {
00020     value => $value, type => $Value::Type{complex}, isConstant => 1,
00021     ref => $ref, equation => $equation,
00022   }, $class;
00023   $num->weaken;
00024   my $z = $self->Package("Complex",$context)->make($context,@{$value});
00025   $num->{isOne}  = 1 if ($z cmp 1) == 0;
00026   $num->{isZero} = 1 if $z == 0;
00027   return $num;
00028 }
00029 
00030 #
00031 #  We know the answer to these, so no need to compute them.
00032 #
00033 sub isComplex {1}
00034 sub isNumber {1}
00035 sub isRealNumber {0}
00036 
00037 #
00038 #  Use Value.pm to evaluate these
00039 #
00040 sub eval {
00041   my $self = shift;
00042   return $self->Package("Complex")->make($self->context,@{$self->{value}});
00043 }
00044 
00045 #
00046 #  Factor out a common negative.
00047 #
00048 sub reduce {
00049   my $self = shift; my ($a,$b) = @{$self->{value}};
00050   my $context = $self->context; my $reduce = $context->{reduction};
00051   if ($reduce->{'-a-bi'} && $a <= 0 && $b <= 0 && ($a != 0 || $b != 0)) {
00052     $self->{value} = [-$a,-$b];
00053     $self = Parser::UOP::Neg($self);
00054     $self->{isOne} = 1 if $self->Package("Complex")->make($context,-$a,-$b) eq "1";
00055   }
00056   return $self;
00057 }
00058 
00059 $Parser::reduce->{'-a-bi'} = 1;
00060 
00061 #
00062 #  Use Value::Complex to format the number
00063 #  Add parens if the parent oparator has higher precedence
00064 #    than addition (and there IS an addition or subtraction).
00065 #
00066 sub string {
00067   my $self = shift; my $precedence = shift;
00068   my $context = $self->context; my $plus = $context->{operators}{'+'}{precedence};
00069   my $z = $self->Package("Complex")->make($context,@{$self->{value}})->string($self->{equation});
00070   $z = "(".$z.")" if defined($precedence) && $precedence > $plus && $z =~ m/[-+]/;
00071   return $z;
00072 }
00073 
00074 sub TeX {
00075   my $self = shift; my $precedence = shift;
00076   my $context = $self->context; my $plus = $context->{operators}{'+'}{precedence};
00077   my $z = $self->Package("Complex")->make($context,@{$self->{value}})->TeX($self->{equation});
00078   $z = '\left('.$z.'\right)' if defined($precedence) && $precedence > $plus && $z =~ m/[-+]/;
00079   return $z;
00080 }
00081 
00082 sub perl {
00083   my $self = shift; my $parens = shift;
00084   my $perl = $self->Package("Complex")->make($self->context,@{$self->{value}})->perl;
00085   $perl = '('.$perl.')' if $parens;
00086   return $perl;
00087 }
